summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2015 CROSSROADS REDWOOD FIFTH WHEEL. THE CONTACT STATED THAT MICE ENTERED THE VEHICLE AND CHEWED COMPLETELY THROUGH THE ELECTRICAL AND WATER LINES. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER. THE TECHNICIAN VERIFIED THE ISSUE AND REPLACED BOTH THE ELECTRICAL AND WATER LINES. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS UNKNOWN.   UPDATED 04/29/16*LJ VIN INVALID FOR CARFAX UPDATED 5/10/18 *JB *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2015 CROSSROADS REDWOOD CAMPER. WHILE BEING TOWED BY A 2008 FORD F-250 AT 50 MPH, THE VEHICLE FAILED TO REMAIN IN POSITION AND TILTED TO THE RIGHT. IN ADDITION, THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE AIR CONDITIONING UNIT FAILED TO FULLY FUNCTION AND WOULD ONLY COOL THE VEHICLE BETWEEN 6 TO 8 DEGREES LOWER THAN THE OUTSIDE TEMPERATURE. THE CONTACT ALSO DISCOVERED THAT WATER WAS LEAKING FROM THE REAR END CAP. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO A DEALER WHO STATED THAT BOTH AXLES AND THE REAR AIR CONDITIONER WERE IMPROPERLY MOUNTED, BUT WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 600.
